caseProcess.description: The case of intentional homicide by M. Harris was officially filed and an investigation was launched by the Preston, Lancaster, Procuratorate.
Initial detention measures were taken, and M. Harris was taken into custody for the purpose of further investigation and questioning.
Formal criminal detention of M. Harris was authorized as sufficient evidence was gathered to warrant continued custody.
An arrest warrant was issued, and M. Harris was formally arrested on charges of intentional homicide.

details.behavior: M. Harris intentionally tampered with the brakes of the car owned by her business partner, J. Thompson, with the intent to cause a fatal accident.
details.evidence: Security camera footage showing M. Harris accessing the garage, expert testimony linking the tampering to the cause of the accident, and text messages revealing her premeditated intent.

details.behavior: M. Harris provided false information to authorities regarding her whereabouts during the time of the incident in an attempt to create an alibi.
details.evidence: Phone GPS data contradicting her statements and witness testimony from neighbors placing her near the scene.

details.behavior: M. Harris destroyed potential evidence by attempting to delete incriminating text messages and emails.
details.evidence: Forensic computer analysis revealing deleted messages and digital footprints indicating deliberate attempts to conceal evidence.

judgmentResult.sentencingConsiderations: The severity of premeditated intent, the clear malice aforethought, and the attempted destruction of evidence.
